title: 111_hr437
content: The Act is titled the "Madera Water Supply Enhancement Act" and includes definitions for various terms. The "Madera Water Supply Enhancement Act" defines key terms such as District (referring to Madera Irrigation District), Project (referring to Madera Water Supply Enhancement Project), and Secretary (referring to the Secretary of the United States Department of the Interior). The "Madera Water Supply Enhancement Act" defines key terms such as District (Madera Irrigation District), Project (Madera Water Supply Enhancement Project), and Secretary (Secretary of the United States Department of the Interior). Total cost includes planning, design, permitting, construction, and land acquisition for the Project. The "Madera Water Supply Enhancement Act" defines key terms and states that the Project is feasible without further studies. The Secretary must comply with applicable Federal laws. A cooperative agreement is also established. The Project authorized by the "Madera Water Supply Enhancement Act" requires a cooperative agreement between the Secretary and the District outlining responsibilities for engineering, design, construction, and contract administration. The Secretary is authorized to enter into a cooperative agreement with the District for the final design and construction of the Project, with a total cost not exceeding $90,000,000. The Federal share of the capital costs shall not exceed 25 percent, and the District will receive credit for non-Federal work towards the cost of the Project. The Secretary will contribute towards the Project's costs for in-kind services, District expenses, and land acquisition. The District is solely responsible for the Project's operation and maintenance. Before funding design or construction, the Secretary will collaborate with the District to ensure compliance with Federal law. The Secretary will collaborate with the District to use existing plans and designs for the Project, ensuring compliance with Federal laws. The assistance provided does not transfer title, responsibility, or liability to the United States. $22,500,000 or 25% of the total Project cost is authorized for appropriation. SEC. 6. SUNSET. The Secretary's authority under this Act will end 10 years after its enactment.
